CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert Grant, cab driver, 826 Delmont Ave., Beltzhoover was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 12, 1959, pg.A1 with question: "Do you think that the President of the United States should intervene in the steel strike, or should he wait, and then invoke the 80-day 'cooling off' period as prescribed in the Taft-Hartley Act?" answer reads: "I don't think he should intervene, because many of the rank-and-file members were dissatisfied with some of the fringe benefits in the last three-year contract. They want to get these benefits straight this time."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert Grant wearing moustache and shirt with embroidered decoration on breast pocket, standing in front of Williams BAR B Q
